title: As R4 Draft Admin, I want to see a No School player's hometown as part of the submission
custom_steps:
Currently, No School player do not get displayed with any city, state, etc, on any draft screens or results.

AC:

* When a No School player is select on the Draft Day screen, the City, State/Province, Country will be populated by the playerâ€™s primary address on their profile
* This address information will continue to be displayed in the draft results widgets and draft related reports

title: As a R4 Admin, I want Clubs Prevented from Submitting Picks as LF, CF, or RF
custom_steps:
AC:

* On the Clubâ€™s Draft Day Screen, the position dropdown will no longer have the following options:
** LF,
** CF
** RF
* The BOCâ€™s Draft Day screen will retain these options

title: As a BOC Admin, I want salaries by level updated for Add Cs
custom_steps:
Context: â€œIt's not preventing them from submitting (they can just hit ignore and continue) but it is confusing clubs and they end up submitting those old values because EBIS is telling them too. And then my understanding is the old values automatically populate as well so many clubs just aren't changing them.â€�



AC:

* The Salary rule check for salary by level will be updated to match what is dictated by the new mCBA
* The default domestic and alien salary structures will also be updated

title: As a BOC Admin, I want a 7 Day Minimum For Players Assigned to the Development List
custom_steps:
AC:

* Players Placed on the Development List must be remain there for a minimum of 7 days
* If the Reinstatement Date is less than 7 days from the placement date, there will be a Player to Replace dropdown displayed
** The dropdown will be required for submission
*** BOC Users will be able to ignore and continue if the field is left blank
** Dropdown will be populated with all players in the Org

title: Upgrade Postgres database to latest supported version (was 14.5 as of 4/20/2023).
custom_steps: Upgrade Postgres database to latest supported version (was 14.5 as of 4/20/2023).

title: Move EBIS off of AWS base SES Email to Mailgun
custom_steps: Reason: Corporate has moved away from AWS.  We can use cloud agnostic Mailgun.

title: As a Drug Test Admin, I want Trainer Info on matched players to be connected to the trainer db
custom_steps:
AC:

* If a match is chosen when creating a drug test request, the trainer info section will be an autocomplete dropdown
* The autocomplete will be connected to the ebis trainer db
* Selecting a trainer and saving will update the existing player profile
* This change will only come into play when a match is chosen, if it is a new player, the existing workflow will persist

Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISII-20849|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISII-20849|smart-link]

title: Draftbot | upgrade link to v1
As a Drug Testing Admin, I want date filters on the Drug Test Request widget
As a BOC Admin, I want ebis to print the new 2023 version of the mUPC
custom_steps:
AC:

* There will be a new version of the Domestic First Year and Non-First Year mUPC
* When a MNC is printed, it will match the language in the provided documents
** Language should be compared on all Addendums
* On the Addendum A:
** Population of new fields will be covered in future story, but this story should cover the layout of the printed document
** Only include the Contract Term language that is relevant to the contract type
*** Domestic First Year gets the language that states (For First-Year Players Only)
*** Non-First Year gets the (For Non-First-Year Players Only)
*** Do not include text in parentheses
* Boilerplate on Add B will be updated
** Included provisions will continue being printed as expected
* Add C
** Domestic First Year contracts will only have the First-Year-Contract section
** Non-First-Year will only get the Non-First-Year-Contract Section
** If the player has an MJC in Terms Confirmed or greater, only the â€œPlayer Signed to MJ UPCâ€� section will be included
** All three scenarios will get the â€˜All Contractsâ€™ section
** The headers (underlined) will not be included
* Add E will be printed blank, as indicated
* Addendum Fs and Gs, if included, will match the text in the attachments
* Addendum Hâ€™s will be handled in a future story
* All Boilerplate will match the provided documents
** Blank Articles will be provided later
* Life Insurance Consent will match the provided document
* Execution pages will match the provided document
* The system will continue to be able to stamp the contracts successfully

title: As a BOC Admin, I want a warning returned if an Investigation request is submitted or approved for an un-registered player
As a BOC Admin, I want ebis to determine MNC Type Based on Signing Club
custom_steps:
Context: All players signed to a Domestic Affiliate must be on a Domestic contract

AC:

* If a player not subject to the R4 Draft has a new 1st year contract created, the system will create a First Year International Contract for the player by default
* If the user selects a signing club that is a domestic affiliate (not in the DSL), the contract will reload as a First Year Domestic Contract



Note: this should not come into play for First Year Domestic Contracts or Non-First Year Contracts

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Australian Statuatory Declaration includes on Domestic First-Year Contracts, when necessary
custom_steps:
Wiki: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784721/Minor+Contract+Printing+Rules|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3784721/Minor+Contract+Printing+Rules|smart-link] 

Context: With the potential for international players to sign domestic contracts, the domestic contract needs to be updated to handle intl scenarios, in this case, printing Australian Statuatory Declaration.

AC:

* Disclaimer: this logic should match what is currently being done on the Intl First Year Contracts
* If a player is from Australia, the Australian Statutory Declaration will be printed with the Addendum H
* The players Age will dictate which version of the form is included

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to see Add H on Domestic First Year MNCs
custom_steps:
AC:

* The Addendum H will appear as an option on Domestic First Year Contracts
* The Add H will default to No
* If the Add H is included on the contract, it will work as expected
** It will work the same as it does on the Intl First-Year Contracts

Note: there are multiple types of Add H based on the playerâ€™s country

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the Add B portion of Non-First Year Minor Contracts updated
custom_steps:
AC:

* The following Add B provisions will be removed from Non-First Year MN Contracts:
** Minor -League Terms
*** Opening Day Roster Bonus
*** Remain On Roster Bonus
** Major-League Terms
*** MLR 9(c) Provision
*** Payroll Deduction Clause
*** Major League Spring Training Invite
* Clubs will no longer have the ability to add Minor League Miscellaneous
** The Yes/No toggle will be inactive for Club Users
** BOC Users will be able to add the provision
* Clubs will no longer have the ability to add Major League Miscellaneous
** The Yes/No toggle will be inactive for Club Users
** BOC Users will be able to add the provision

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the Add B portion of Domestic First Year Contracts updated
custom_steps:
AC:

* The following Add B covenants will be added to the Domestic First Year MN Contracts
** Signing Bonus with Visa Contingency
** Dual Sport Language with Visa Contingency
** Age and Identity Fraud
* These provisions will be included conditionally and will only appear if the player is an international player (not subject to the Rule 4 draft)
** If the player is subject to the Rule 4 draft, they will not be displayed.
* These provisions will be included in the printed contract and will be displayed as expected.

title: As a developer I want the employee bench eligible batch to call the new stored procedure for updates
custom_steps:
The new procedure developed for [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1577|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1577|smart-link]  should be called from the bench eligible batch as well.

The proc should not be directly called, instead it should call a second procedure passing in person_id and user_name which calls the actual procedure, passing in the current date.



This is to provide flexibility if we determine that we need additional logic in place before making the actual updates.

title: As a developer I want the employee dugout utility to be built using the audit log as a blueprint
custom_steps:
The dugout utility for an employee should be generated using the records in the audit log as a blueprint.

Any updates that are made to the employee should first insert a record to the audit log and then call a stored procedure which takes in:

PERSON_ID
EFFECTIVE_DT - date to calculate the utility as of
USER_NAME - user making the update

The procedure will track:

ORG_ID, POSITION_ID, SHOW_ON_ROSTER_FLAG, EMP_TITLE, START_DT

Starting values for each data point come from the day prior to the EFFECTIVE_DTâ€™s values in the bench eligible table for that person_id.  If there is no existing record, then each value starts as null

The first step for the proc is to delete all eligible records on or later than the effective date

From there, each day to be processed will fetch all audit logs for that day and apply them in turn to the tracked values.

Logic:

Find an added to bench eligible: set the ORG_ID
Find a removed from bench eligible: unset all fields
Find added contract title: set the EMP_TITLE
Find Removal of employee from org: unset all fields
Find assignment/reassignment of position: get the new position from the linked transaction and set it to POSITION_ID
Find added on field designation: set SHOW_ON_ROSTER_FLAG

Find removed on field designation: unset SHOW_ON_ROSTER_FLAG

Once all records for the day have been processed, if the ORG_ID is populated, insert a new record for that day with the appropriate values and move on to the next day.  

Repeat the process until the current date is completed

if the current_dateâ€™s SHOW_ON_ROSTER_FLAG value does not match the SHOW_ON_ROSTER_FLAG value in EMP_INFO, update EMP_INFO to match the current dateâ€™s value.

This procedure should be called after making the appropriate audit log updates upon saving an employee on the utility or approving the ASGEE/RELEE transaction (batch will be handled in a separate story).

title: As a developer I want the dugout audit log to link to the ASGEE/RELEE transactions generating the update
custom_steps:
If an ASGEE/RELEE updates an employees dugout eligible utility and adds an audit log item that audit log item should be linked to the transaction via transaction_id in the database.

If the transaction is then reversed and/or suppressed the associated audit log record should be logically deleted from the table and should no longer appear in the widget or be factored into generating the employees eligible utility records.

There will be no updates on the actual widget as a result of this link.

title: As a Developer I want the dugout audit log to track title changes
custom_steps: Whenever an employeeâ€™s title is updated on the eligible utility by a user the audit log should track that the update occurred as well as store the new title for the employee in the table.

** The term length will be populated by the value entered into the Term prompt
** Addendum C will include the â€œNon-First Year Contractâ€�

title: As a BOC Admin, I want SFNY in DSL Players Automatically Activated When Transferred to a Domestic Affiliate
custom_steps:
Context: Players assigned to domestic affiliates may no longer have a status of SFNY.

AC:

* On Submit:
** If a SFNY player, assigned to a DSL affiliate, has a transfer to a domestic affiliate submitted, the system will return a warning:
*** Title: Warning
*** Text: Players assigned to domestic affiliates may not be SFNY.  This player will be activated upon approval of this transaction.
*** Buttons: Continue, Back
** Clicking Back will dismiss the warning and return the user to the transaction
** Clicking Continue will submit the transaction
* On Approval:
** When approving a transfer of a SFNY player from the DSL to a domestic affiliate, the system will return a warning:
*** Title: Warning
*** Text: Players assigned to domestic affiliates may not be SFNY.  This player will be activated upon approval of this transaction.
*** Buttons: Continue, Back
** Clicking Back will dismiss the warning and return the user to the transaction
** Clicking Continue will approve the transaction, transfer the player, and update their status to Active

title: Upgrade EBIS to latest Java 8 upgrade
custom_steps: As a follow up to the opening day EBIS incident where global ran out of memory, we should update our JRE to the latest Java version. To do this, we will also need to switch our JRE distro, as openjdk no longer pushes Java 8 upgrades.
